channel.title: Home on gg

item.title: Gerrit
item.description: Cloning Cloning a Gerrit repository is as simple as using the gg clone command. You can install the commit hook that adds the Change-Id line to your commit messages by using gg gerrithook. gg clone https://example.com/foo.git cd foo gg gerrithook Making Changes Every Gerrit change should be on a separate branch. gg branch will automatically handle setting the branch’s upstream, and gg mail automates pushing the change to the server.
